statement.p: In 42.5 of the last 40 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{40}}={0.425}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{40}. \displaystyle{P}={0.425}\cdot{40}={17}. This is the number of days that it rained. We want the non-rainy days which is 40-17=23 We round that as requested to 23.
